title: Blinking cursor when window not focused
body:
Issue Type: Bug Happens on Mac. Can reproduce constantly by having a (one or more) Visual Studio Code editor and another window (Chrome for me). Let the other window have focus, lock the screen (apple icon -> lock screen), log in again and then all visual studio code editors have blinking cursors even though the other app has focus. The blinking cursors don't go away until the editor has regained focus and lost it again. (Just as an FYI this report was not possible to submit through the in-editor-report-button. When pressing "Preview on GitHub" all I got was a server-error) VS Code version: Code 1.38.1 (b37e54c98e1a74ba89e03073e5a3761284e3ffb0, 2019-09-11T13:31:32.854Z) OS version: Darwin x64 18.7.0

title: Please add a configuration file to control which extensions are enabled or disabled
body:
<!-- Please search existing issues to avoid creating duplicates. -->

<!-- Describe the feature you'd like. -->
Overall, vscode is great, and I'd like you to add a new feature: for extensions, you can have a special configuration file under the.vscode folder to control which plug-ins you need to enable for the project itself. Plug-ins not in the list are automatically disabled in the workspace, plug-ins in the list are automatically enabled, and uninstalled plug-ins can be automatically installed. I thought it would be cool and we could make sure that all the plug-ins we enabled were needed for the project.

title: Source control default message disappears after a commit sometimes
body:
<!-- Please search existing issues to avoid creating duplicates. -->
<!-- Also please test using the latest insiders build to make sure your issue has not already been fixed: https://code.visualstudio.com/insiders/ -->

<!-- Use Help > Report Issue to prefill these. -->
- VSCode Version: 1.36.1
- OS Version: macOS mojave 10.14.6

Steps to Reproduce:
Doesn't consistently happen.

1. Make changes to a file (on remote ssh, for me)
2. Stage changes using the source control feature in vs code
3. Edit commit message (at this point, the default commit message is usually there in vs code source control feature)
4. Commit changes (using command line or feature in vs code)
5. When it finishes, sometimes it has no default commit message

Have also tried invoking git: refresh but it doesn't come back without sshing back in.

When it breaks:
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/6328033/66614508-2e7f1d80-eb7e-11e9-95d9-8645738af090.png)
After I restart vs code & sign back in to remote ssh, it works again. Isn't a breaking bug, but it does take me out of my workflow because I have to restart the application.
After restart / before it breaks:
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/6328033/66614513-33dc6800-eb7e-11e9-96a2-f9220ea41d90.png)
<!-- Launch with `code --disable-extensions` to check. -->
Does this issue occur when all extensions are disabled?: Yes/No
Can't launch without extensions because using remote ssh

title: Reveal in Sidebar crashes
body:
- VSCode Version: 1.39
- OS Version: Darwin x64 18.7.0

This doesn't happen consistently, but every once in a while, this feature would completely crash and I'd have to restart my editor. The steps are as follows:

* I open a folder, I start editing some code.
* I right click the tab name, and click `Reveal in Sidebar`.
* The whole File explorer is highlighted in blue, without my file actually getting highlighted.

I checked the dev tools, and here is the error that gets shown:

```
  ERR TreeError [FileExplorer] Data tree node not found: [object Object]: Error: TreeError [FileExplorer] Data tree node not found: [object Object]
    at WorkbenchAsyncDataTree.getDataNode (file:///Applications/VS Code.app/Contents/Resources/app/out/vs/workbench/workbench.desktop.main.js:64272:23)
    at WorkbenchAsyncDataTree.reveal (file:///Applications/VS Code.app/Contents/Resources/app/out/vs/workbench/workbench.desktop.main.js:64253:35)
    at ExplorerView.onSelectResource (file:///Applications/VS Code.app/Contents/Resources/app/out/vs/workbench/workbench.desktop.main.js:292485:31)
```

I traced it down to this line:
https://github.com/microsoft/vscode/blob/b0dccbcf75fd03ac8cc0fa94da5c552a4f47309d/src/vs/base/browser/ui/tree/asyncDataTree.ts#L650

Which indiates that tree items are refreshed/updated somehow, but the key used to look up this map is still referring to the old object? Should this map be indexed by something else? item id (string)?

title: VS Code and Polish charaters bug
body:
Ubuntu 19.04, Visual Studio Code 1.38.1:

When I type text and press polish character the cursor moves left so that the order of letters is reversed. Say I wanted to type abc', where c was Polish c with an accent then when I have typed ab and start typing c' the cursor moves before b, so that I am typing like: ac'b.

In fact the cursor moves to the left when I press the polich characters selector which is the right Alt Gr on polish programmers keyboard.

Any time I press "Alt Gr" the cursor moves to the left, like as I was pressing the left arrow. Perhaps some bug in Linux or in VS Code. But it make typing quite impossible.

I've checked it does not occur in Windows 10/VS Code 1.38.1.

title: Trusted domain prompt skipped when using openExternal
body: Issue Type: Bug 1. Run `Manage Trusted Domains` and comment out all domains 2. Using the GitHub Pull Request extension, run the `GitHub Pull Requests: Sign in to GitHub` command Expected: Trusted domains dialog is shown when opening the url to authenticate. When the authentication completes and returns to VSCode, no prompt is shown since the callback url was created with `createAppUri` Actual: No dialog is shown when opening the url to the auth server. When authentication completes, the "Allow an extension to open this URI?" prompt is shown VS Code version: Code - Insiders 1.40.0-insider (193fead4103363d1a14873bcf38181d97cf611f6, 2019-10-10T05:24:52.897Z) OS version: Darwin x64 18.7.0

title: Provide auto-completion on function parameters (TypeScript)
body:
<!-- Please search existing issues to avoid creating duplicates. -->
<!-- Also please test using the latest insiders build to make sure your issue has not already been fixed: https://code.visualstudio.com/insiders/ -->

<!-- Use Help > Report Issue to prefill these. -->
- VSCode Version: 1.39.0
- OS Version: Ubuntu 18.04

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Parameter hints do **not work** if `fn` **is optional**

```ts
type fn = (a: string, b: object) => boolean

type obj = {
    fn?: fn
}

const test: obj = {
    fn: (/** parameter hints not working */) => true,
}
```

2. Parameter hints do **work** if `fn` is **not optional**

```ts
type obj = {
    fn: fn
}

const test: obj = {
    fn: (/** parameter hints working */) => true,
}
```

<!-- Launch with `code --disable-extensions` to check. -->
Does this issue occur when all extensions are disabled?: **Yes**/No

title: ArchLinux: Support saving as sudo
body:
Hello,

the issue #70403 turns down the blame to `upstream` (arch linux), but arch linux turns down the blame back to `vscode`. See https://bugs.archlinux.org/task/61516, specifically the comments.

> No, it is an upstream [vscode] issue. We [arch linux] are sane people so we don't distribute a full copy of electron with VS Code, we use the electron already present on your system. This is the exact same reason why we use dynamic libraries instead of statically linking everything. It is on the upstream for not supporting this properly, I already took the appropriate actions to try get them to look into this but they don't seem interested. I can't do anything other that hope someone looks into this.

The bugfix of #70403 would be really appreciated - it's troublesome not being able to use the `save file as sudo` feature.

See also:

https://wiki.archlinux.org/index.php/Visual_Studio_Code#Saving_with_%22Retry_as_Sudo%22_does_not_work

Many thanks!

title: SCM: Allow folders as resources when rendering as tree
body:
Users have found out in https://github.com/microsoft/vscode/issues/82203 that most other SCM providers break the tree rendering. This happens because they provide folders as resources themselves, which simply breaks the tree.

This should actually just be supported, but we need to address what happens to the contextual menus. With the tree rendering addition, folders have their own context key for menus. Currently in these SCM providers, the folders have the same actions as the files and maybe that's intended, so we should preserve that.

I suggest the following:

1. If a folder is provided as a resource, simply use the regular resource context key, thus maintaining the current behavior. Also, we need to change the _should expand on twistie click only_ behavior, since those resources might have a command to run when clicked.
2. Else, populate the menu using the new folder context key.
3. Remove the proposed API additions introduced in https://github.com/microsoft/vscode/issues/82203

This allows us to continue to move forward without adding or removing anything from the API.

title: Go to definition stopped working
body:
I use to have `alt+click` to go to definition. But it stopped working.

<!-- Use Help > Report Issue to prefill these. -->
- VSCode Version: 1.39.0
- OS Version: Ubuntu 18.04

Steps to Reproduce:

1. `"editor.multiCursorModifier": "ctrlCmd",`

I tried `"editor.multiCursorModifier": "alt",` and it makes multi-cursor not to work. So it seems that there is problems with `alt`. The rest of the shorcuts work weel with `alt`, though.

(& my `alt` button isn't broken :laughing:)

<!-- Launch with `code --disable-extensions` to check. -->
Does this issue occur when all extensions are disabled?: **Yes**

title: Regression: Cannot edit code in right pane in the Source Control diff view
body:
This was my regular workflow, edit a bunch of code in C++, and see the diff (in the Source Control view) and edit. But I am getting: "Cannot edit in read-only editor"

No extensions are installed, (even used the switch --disable-extensions), I searched online, and they said to install "Code Runner" and use terminal, that didn't help.

Now my workflow is interrupted, if I see anything wrong in my PR, I need to Ctrl+P to find the file and open it in the Files View., I have hundred thousands of files and it becomes a hassle. (I am working on the Chromium code base).

Version: 1.39.0 (user setup)
Commit: 9df03c6d6ce97c6645c5846f6dfa2a6a7d276515
Date: 2019-10-09T06:58:04.439Z
Electron: 4.2.10
Chrome: 69.0.3497.128
Node.js: 10.11.0
V8: 6.9.427.31-electron.0
OS: Windows_NT x64 10.0.18363
Does this issue occur when all extensions are disabled?: Yes

title: Output file (firmware.bin) not updated upon compilation completion
body:
Issue Type: Bug mvsc, marlin 2.0.xbugfix. Now sure how to "share" steps needed, but msvc will not update the "firmware.bin" file regardless of what changes are made in configuration.h or configuration_adv.h. The "new" firmware.bin is exactly identical to something from an unknown time ago and running "diff" on them shows they are IDENTICAL!!! Also, random and frequent of complete msvc crashes. VS Code version: Code 1.39.0 (9df03c6d6ce97c6645c5846f6dfa2a6a7d276515, 2019-10-09T06:58:03.188Z) OS version: Linux x64 4.9.0-11-amd64

title: Search in selection highlight sometimes loses border
body:
I can't work out exactly what causes it, but sometimes the blue highlight around the search in selection button is not present:

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/376658/66571449-34b5cf80-eb67-11e9-9cc2-b69e13d7e43c.png)

So search is selection is enabled, but is indicated by grey on grey. :disappointed: 

Sometimes it is shown (a blue border) when I click the button, but then clicking outside the search widget, the icon is then greyed out? I assume this is because there is no selection.

It's all a bit confusing.

title: Cannot read property 'openConfigFile' of undefined
body:
I have a workaround for this, but it seems to be a bug. I also tried the latest insiders version. 

- VSCode Version: 1.39.0, enabled extension: C/C++; Version 0.25.1
- OS Version: Lubuntu 19.04, issue also on Windows 10 and Ubuntu 18.04

Steps to Reproduce:

1. delete VSCode-Config folder (home/../.config/Code)
2. open VSCode 
3. open folder with simple cpp-file 
4. Click on Debug --> "Add Configuration..."
error message "Cannot read property 'openConfigFile' of undefined" appears.

Workaround is: Debug --> "Open Configurations" --> C++(GDB/LLDB)
--> launch.json is created

Removing launch.json again and then clicking on "Add Configuration..." works. 

So, it doesn't work at the first time using "Add Configuration.."

Does this issue occur when all extensions are disabled?: Yes
